item.title: ::pickup prob
item.dc:creator: @dude1332 dude1332
item.description:
@dude1332 wrote:

[quote=“Anikan1937, post:10, topic:327543”]thats because you guys screwed up on the code “sM” is for delta servers, and his is a czar because he is using “sendMessage” and another point to that is he gets 100 errors when he used Dude’s code. and the odds of him just missing a bracket is slim.
the correct code for czars (317) is:

[code] if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && (playerRights >= 1)) {

Sorry for double post but thanks to you to
try {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7, 12));
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13));

            if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0) {
                addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
            } else {
                sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Exist");
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sendMessage("WRONG TYPE IT AGAIN DIFFRENTLY! ");
        }
    }[/code][/quote][quote="Trent!!, post:7, topic:327543"]go back to your original code.

compile it
and when you do pickup command make sure it has five numbers.
so for example.

item ID 1 would be

::pickup 00001 1

also dont forget to put how many you want after it.
this usually is the problem with allstar scape.[/quote][quote=“Trent!!, post:7, topic:327543”]go back to your original code.

compile it
and when you do pickup command make sure it has five numbers.
so for example.

item ID 1 would be

::pickup 00001 1

also dont forget to put how many you want after it.
this usually is the problem with allstar scape.[/quote]

the ::pickup 00001 1 thing

item.title: ::pickup prob
item.dc:creator: @Anikan1937 Anikan1937
item.description:
@Anikan1937 wrote:

thats because you guys screwed up on the code “sM” is for delta servers, and his is a czar because he is using “sendMessage” and another point to that is he gets 100 errors when he used Dude’s code. and the odds of him just missing a bracket is slim.
the correct code for czars (317) is:

[code] if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && (playerRights >= 1)) {
try {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7, 12));
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13));

            if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0) {
                addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
            } else {
                sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Exist");
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sendMessage("WRONG TYPE IT AGAIN DIFFRENTLY! ");
        }
    }[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: ::pickup prob
item.dc:creator: @dude1332 dude1332
item.description:
@dude1332 wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:6, topic:327543”][code]if (command.startsWith(“item”) && playerRights >= 2) {
String[] args = command.split(" ");
if(args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);

That works
if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) {
addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
sM(“No such item.”);
}
} else {
sM(“Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100”);
}
}[/code]

Theres nothing wrong with that, check where you added it.[/quote][quote=“Trent!!, post:7, topic:327543”]go back to your original code.

compile it
and when you do pickup command make sure it has five numbers.
so for example.

item ID 1 would be

::pickup 00001 1

also dont forget to put how many you want after it.
this usually is the problem with allstar scape.[/quote]

item.title: ::pickup prob
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

if (command.startsWith("item") && playerRights >= 2) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sM("No such item."); } } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } }

Theres nothing wrong with that, check where you added it.

item.title: ::pickup prob
item.dc:creator: @dude1332 dude1332
item.description:
@dude1332 wrote:

when i type ::pickup ## # it says here is your item. but there isnt an item. i am owner of the server with allstar source and version 317

[code] }

    if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerRights >= 3)) {
        try {
            int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7, 12));
            int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13));

            if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0) {
                addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
            } else {
                sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Exist");
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sendMessage("Here is your item! ");
        }
    }

[/code]

Read full topic
